snippet: As China seeks to become more competitive, scientists on the job in the United States are being asked to share technology data.
abstract: Chinese scientists working in United States and other developed countries are being heavily recruited to return to China to share technology data, as nation seeks to become more competitive; revelations come from federal court case and book released by three experts who conduct research for US government and say that so-called technology transfer is official government policy in China.

byline.original: By EDWARD WONG and DIDI KIRSTEN TATLOW
byline.contributor: Edward Wong reported from Shenzhen and Beijing, and Didi Kirsten Tatlow reported from Beijing. Patrick Zuo contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: As China seeks to become more competitive, scientists on the job in the United States are being asked to share technology data.
